session_synopses.AD_Tiefling011: Zorru calls out his reactions in ADs during different states of the druid attack.
session_synopses.GruntingKid: Tiefling kid who communicates by grunting during and after druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling010: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee003: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Gan is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's full of bravado - she's had training with a wooden sword, and she's eager to show off. She doesn't quite grasp the seriousness of the situation.
session_synopses.Chef: This dialogues occurs after the druid attack. Okta is relieved that they survived and drained from being tierrified (not that she would admit it). She's trying to be tough and no nonsense about the entire event.
session_synopses.ServantGnome: Loic has lost all his patience in this dialogue - you commited a crime, and he's really angry and disgusted. This happens right before he starts to attack the player.
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: Aelar has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
session_synopses.Stargazer: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsAfterAttack: Parents are mourning the death of their child after the druid attack. They hang around the grove and wonder what will follow.
session_synopses.Griefling: Arka reacts to the druids attacking the tieflings in the grove.
session_synopses.ServantIntolerant: Marcoryl is only too delighted to fight the tieflings. This is during the druid attack and he is eager to put down these 'hellspawn.'
session_synopses.AD_HideoutLeader: Two scared young tieflings: Mol protects Zavi during the druid attack
session_synopses.Tiefling011: Zorru one-liner reacting to druid attack state. Zorru has a proven dislike of githyanki, so those reactions are a bit different.
session_synopses.Trainee002: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Ide is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. She's frightened while they are attacking, but shakes it off quickly afterward. She's just impressed that the player could take on so many druids.
session_synopses.DruidGuard003: Spoken just before the Druids turn hostile against the tiefling refugees.
session_synopses.AD_FleeAfter: AD when Zorru flees attack on grove. He's fearful and running for his life.
session_synopses.AD_ProtestersAfterAttack: Three tieflings (who had previously been protesting their treatment at the hands of their druid hosts) react to the aftermath of a bloody confrontation between tiefling refugees and druids. In this instance the druids have all been killed. The refugees are shaken and angry.
session_synopses.CharmedKid: Two states: one where the child is about to get attacked by the druids and is panicking, and one where the player has saved him and he's grateful.
session_synopses.AD_DruidOpposed: Rath is defending the tieflings as Sagha and the other druids attempt to drive them out.
session_synopses.SonOfChef: This dialogue plays either while the druids are attacking the tieflings in the grove, or after the druids have been defeated. During the attack, Ikaron is entirely focused on saving his people from the druids. Afterward, he's introspective, hurt that he and his people have had another safe harbour turn against him. Still, he is glad the players were there to help win the day.
session_synopses.DruidLeader: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile. In case player clicks on druid before hostility is fully set.
session_synopses.ScoutCaptive: A druid we saved from some goblins earlier - regretfully telling us it's too late to leave - his people are going to kill us.lNPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.
session_synopses.Apprentice: NPC Dialog during the Druid Attack state, before the Druids turn hostile.
session_synopses.LINE_DruidToCombat: The player angered the druids by tampering with the Idol of Silvanus of by performing a serious crime.Kagha reacts if it's triggering near her. Otherwise, 'generic' druids are used for the off screen voices and call to arms shot.Can also trigger if the player goes hostile to Kagha in dialogue.

AD_Ritual.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: We wasted so much time fighting each other.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The danger has passed, but there was much infighting in the druid grove, which he believes put them at higher risk.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Silvanus taught us a lesson by letting an outsider save us.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: Players are the outsider here - they saved the druid grove from both infighting and a goblin attack.

AD_RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
AD_RitualDruid1.text: Complexum tuum... it's still in my head.
AD_RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Prnounced: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, He's got a chant stuck in his head.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.text: You think you saved us? You just prolonged the inevitable.
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.text: Sooner or later, other outsiders will bring trouble to the grove.
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat against the grove is dealt with, but she believes something similar will happen again so long as her fellow druids let outsiders in.

AD_RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2.text: How could we be so blind?
AD_RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha.

AD_RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra... did I say that out loud?
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Dazed. He's been chanting for days. Pronounced: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: We've been chanting for days. I need some rest.

BirdSender.speaker: Player
BirdSender.text: What were you saying to that bird?

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: The bird knows. She needs to know. You do not.

BirdSender.speaker: Player
BirdSender.text: Hmm... Suspicious. Do the other druids know? Because I could tell them.

BirdSender.speaker: Apikusis
BirdSender.text: Before you do that, see how our First Druid treats outsiders. Then decide if you would put your faith in her.

AD_RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4.text: The grove isn't safe. Not anymore.
AD_RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual to seal the druid grove off and drive out the refugees has been stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Elwyn worries that without Kagha - the mastermind of the ritual - they are rudderless, easy targets.

session_synopses.AD_BirdSender: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |
session_synopses.AD_Ritual: Five druids participate in a ritual around a sacred pool. The chant will summon a coccoon of thorns that will encircle their entire grove. Lines play sequentially, each druid saying one line, then the next, etc.They're chanting at a normal to low volume. They're attempting to suss power out from the earth itself, but they're not forcing it out. There should be a loose rhythm to it (think Arwen from LoTR when she summons the river horses), but it shouldn't come across like a drum circle.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingBird: |Talking to her friend and companion, a bird. She wants it to fly over the area and search for her missing master, Halsin. |
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid1: This AD plays after the druid's ritual has been stopped. In this AD, Aelar is dazed from days of chanting.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Tahani is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Tahani is furious that players stopped the ritual - even though Kagha had ulterior motives, Tahani still believes her path was best and that players had no right to intervene.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Tahani isn't convinced the threat is really over. She thinks her fellow druids will lead them down the same path again, taking pity on people that will only bring trouble to their door.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool. She's more or less the xenophobic conservative of the chanting druids.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid3: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Inwe was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Inwe is feeling sorry for herself. She's overcome with shame for being a part of a shadow druid plot.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Inwe isn't quite convinced the danger is over. She's jumping at shadows, imagining danger where there's presumably none.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid2: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Kerrick was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Kerrick feels angry and betrayed - he thought he was part of something good when really he was being used.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Kerrick is reflective and calm. The threat is gone, but there's much to be learned from it.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid5: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Tahani was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In both states, Tahani is bitter, muttering her xenophobic ideas to herself. She thinks the tieflings (and the player) are the cause of all their troubles and that they should've been thrown out a long time ago.
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Aelar is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Aelar is in a daze - several days of chanting have left him a bit loopy.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Aelar is still exhausted, but he's gathered his senses, more or less. The player always encounters Aelar around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.BirdSender: This dialogue can take place in two different states. In the first, Apakusis is short and defensive. The grove's ranking leader, Kagha, has gathered support to close off the grove to outsiders with an intense ritual. She doesn't trust Kagha, and quietly despairs to see her grove turn to such measures.In the second state, the ritual has been stopped. She's shocked at the revelation that Kagha had been involved with Shadow Druids, and is having trouble accepting it.The player finds this druid speaking to a bird in the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid4: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Elwyn was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Elwyn is preoccupied with the goblins - she's afraid that without the protection the ritual would have provided, they don't have a chance against them.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Elwyn is calm, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.

PAD_TunnelTurret.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelTurret.text: Glowing eyes are rarely a good sign. Best be careful.

session_synopses.PAD_TunnelTurret: Played when discovering one of the druid turret totems.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
Group.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
Group.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
Group.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
Group.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
Group.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
Group.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
Group.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: We should add the Elfsong Tavern to the list.
AD.context: NodeContext: Talking about things to do in Baldur's Gate - excited.

AD.speaker: Lia
AD.text: So long as you're paying.
AD.context: NodeContext: A wry smile, you're happy to see your Rolan so excited.

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.text: Drinks on Rolan? Count me in.
AD.context: NodeContext: Your sister has conned Rolan into paying - you're teasing him.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: I swear, I've never met such a pair of cheapskates.
AD.context: NodeContext: A wry smile even as you pretend to be grumpy - Lia and Rolan are teasing you and you're pretending to hate it.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I can spare but a moment - Baldur's Gate awaits! Oh, I can almost smell the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Leaving for Baldur's Gate after a hell of an argument but isn't bothered. Excited to be leaving and seems oblvious to that fact that Lia is next to him, SEETHING.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're cheerful for someone about to abandon his kin.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Well, you're here, aren't you? You can help them if you want.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I don't believe in sacrifices for a lost cause.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: We're leaving for Baldur's Gate. And we will make it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: There's every chance you'll die on the road.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Please. I can handle myself. It's others that are the issue.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: You are looking at Lorroakan's newest apprentice.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Excited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Yes - that Lorroakan. The greatest wizard in Baldur's Gate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: xcited, Eyes light up. This is his dream. He believes he is DESTINED for this.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Never heard of him. Who is he?

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: What? You don't know of him? I've admired him for years.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pride and awe in his voice. He's clearly imagining himself in the same position.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Both his magic and political sway are forces to be reckoned with.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Rest assured, the names 'Rolan' and 'Lorroakan' will be known to you soon enough. You'll see.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive shrug. Stating this like a fact.

session_synopses.Group:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.
session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.
session_synopses: This occurs after the argument with Lia. If they're leaving for Baldur's Gate he's pretty relaxed about the argument and dismissive of Lia and her concerns. If they're staying in the grove, he's furious and is convinced they'll die here.

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Yes... yes I see.
AD.context: NodeContext: REacting to bear noises as though bear is explaining something to him.

AD.speaker: Bosk
AD.text: *Huff!*

AD.speaker: Volo
AD.text: Ah, I do wish I could understand you!
AD.context: NodeContext: REacting to bear noises as though bear is explaining something to him.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Ah, my good friend!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's holding a book and a quill, scribbling notations when he notices you.NodeContext: He's holding a book and a quill, scribbling notations when he notices you. He's happy to see you, he has questions for you!

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Forgive my surprise. It's rare to find your kind above ground. Rare and intriguing on a day already packed with intrigue!
node_data.context: NodeContext: polite and enthusiastic

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: You were at the gates just now, no? When the goblins came? You saw them up close?
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's about to start quizzing you on what you saw. Eager.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: A few questions, if you please. There's no overstating my interest.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He wants to write down what you'll say. Enthusiastic.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Fine - ask your questions.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Glory! Now, then:
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's ready to write, quill to book.NodeContext: Player agreed to answer his questions. He's happy but also arrogant, like a rich old person saying 'you're an absolute DOLL' when you do a minor favor for them.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: How would you describe that particular batch of goblins? Size? Nature? Distinguishing qualities?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Quizzing the player, looking for info for his book. He's more professional here, curious.

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You search your mind, successfully recalling various details of goblin behaviour.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Common variety goblins, led by a lasher and flanked by booyahgs.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: My! A scholar after my own heart. Spent much time among goblins?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: The time was spent among books. I'm a student of the page.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Aha! I've always preferred experience to the second-hand accounts of lesser men. But to each their own!

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Now I've a few more questions, if you don't mind.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: And the... dragon they had marching in the rear. Was it of the brass or silver variety?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Volo is bullshitting. There was no dragon and he knows it. But he's stating it to the player as though he believes it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I think there's been a misunderstanding. What do you want, exactly?

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: The truth, my friend! Not a jot more or less!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Response to 'What are you getting at.' Volo doesn't really want the truth but he believes in his own morality.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: Last question, then you'll be quite free. Did the attackers rally to 'the Absolute' when they fell upon the gates?
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's wrapping things up, in full journalism mode.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Yes - they called out the name like a war cry.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: They did, didn't they? Oh-ho, curious. Curious indeed.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Answers that yes, the goblins used the word 'Absolute'. He's very interested in this; very intrigued. Your confirmation is exactly what he wanted to hear.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: I've interrogated one - a captive in this very camp. She reports they've abandoned their god Maglubiyet in favour of someone called 'the Absolute'.

node_data.speaker: Volo
node_data.text: The scandal!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hissed like he's just conveyed a very juicy bit of gossip

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do you think Maglubiyet makes of this change?

Bear.speaker: Bosk
Bear.text: Just a moment - this man is recording my story.

Bear.speaker: Bosk
Bear.context: NodeContext: Articulating very clearly - he's trying to make someone who can't speak with animals understand what he's saying.

Bear.speaker: Narrator
Bear.text: *As the colourful man starts scribbling, the bear sneaks a quick look at the page.*
Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Volo is excited, writing on the page. The bear leans in to see what he's writing.

Bear.speaker: Narrator
Bear.text: *His brow furrows. Incomprehensible squiggles surround a crude sketch: a bear disembowelling a clutch of tieflings.*

session_synopses.AD: Volo will have some casual behavior around camp. One of these behaviors is to wander over to a druid's tame bear and try to talk to it.
session_synopses: Volo is a canonical character in DnD. He's known for being the realm's go-to guy for compiling information. In this take, he fulfils that role but puts a twist on what he sees. He's keenly curious for facts but likes to embellish them. A bit like Gilderoy Lockheart. He IS talented, but his reputation has gotten away from him, too. In this dialogue, Volo will offer to put his knowledge at your service if you confide you've been infected with a mindflayer. He'll perform an icepick lobotomy that'll leave you without an eye or much in the way of apology from Volo. He should be clever, a little arrogant, very English, and very fun, without being a cartoon character.
session_synopses.Bear: Bear in the druid grove. This is a Speak with Animals dialogue. If Volo is there, we sense his frustration at trying to communicate with Volo (who has been asking him questions in an AD). If Volo isn't there, he wants to know who we are. He gets scared of us when we tell him about the tadpole.

VB_ReturnedToGrove.speaker: Player
VB_ReturnedToGrove.text: I was a slave when we were last here. I do not appreciate being reminded of that.

PAD_DiscoverTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoverTrap.text: I don't like the look of that mushroom. I should stay clear.

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoverTrap: The player has discovered a hostile looking mushroom in the DEN Grove Prison. It's origins are from the Underdark, but have been planted by an inquisitive druid.

AD.speaker: Dammon
AD.text: *Sigh.* I miss my forge.

session_synopses.AD: Idle ADs for the tiefling blacksmith.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: |Cinematic: The woman cradled a carved wooden box, from which a soft melody chimed.|
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lost in thought, holding the box as it's the most precious thing in the world.NodeContext: Sitting

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What are you doing?

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: Oh! Sorry, I'm just... I'm just listening.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Starting out of a reverie - suddenly embarrassed

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I used to hate this tune - told my husband as much when he made the bloody thing.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Laughing, self-deprecating, self-conscious

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: But it kept our little monster quiet. Reason to love it if nothing else, trust me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A tired and exasperated parent, remembering.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: ... how much do you think it's worth? Old Ethel said she'd offer me gold for it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She closes the box and plays her fingers along the lid. Abruptly, she offers it up.NodeContext: Hesitant and suddenly serious, intent on  your response

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gold?  That was barely worth a copper.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: Well... I was hoping for more than that. My husband was carrying all our coin.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Reflective, hedging around something painful

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: We... we met gnolls on the road. I got away, but my husband... my daughter-
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sobbing, breaking downNodeContext: Breaking down into tears

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I'm sorry, I just... I don't know what else to do. They say you need coin to enter the city. For bribes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Embarrassed, confiding

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I don't... what else can I do? They say you need coin to enter the city. For bribes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Composing herself, trying to be pragmatic

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This isn't my problem.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: ... you're right. I'm sure you don't want to listen to my prattling. Sorry.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hurt but hiding it - she's just told you something heartbreaking and you've dismissed her trauma.

session_synopses: Nerela is wondering whether to sell a music box, the only memento she has of the husband and daughter who were killed by gnolls on the road here. It's a scam - her story is fabricated and the box is a dime a dozen. Player can comfort her or see through her story. Her overall demeanour is weary, fragile (unless you uncover her scam)

AdventurerLeader.speaker: Aradin

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: I blame you for lockin' us out. Leavin' us to die.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.Adventurer2:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinCaptain: A goblin veteran leading a raid on a druid grove - he's giving orders to his troops
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate: Plea from the adventurer leader at the gates - goblins are almost here, he needs Zevlor to open up! Zevlor is being circumspect.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderRant: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.
session_synopses.VB_ApproachingGate: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.AD_WyllWantsOut: AD used by Wyll when his first combat turn against the goblin raiders start. This should be cried out valiantly! Wyll has arrived to save the day!
session_synopses.PAD_RaidersDefeated: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.
session_synopses.PAD_ConfrontationResolved: READ IN FULL, YOU HAVE TO SCROLL DOWN:VB that plays after DEN_RaidingParty_Confrontation. The dialog ends either with peace having been achieved or with one leader being knocked out by either the opposing leader or a player.This VB has a greeting for each outcome, but there really are three main categories: Player punched a leader, the leaders punched each other OR piece was achieved.Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the player who was in the Confrontation dialog, and as such may have punched one of the leaders.Speaker 2 is an accompanying character and as such may be opinionated.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderToConfrontation: AD the adventurer leader says just before running into the Den to confront the tiefling leader.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.

VB_UnlockedStudy.speaker: Player
VB_UnlockedStudy.text: Well well, what have we here.

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text:
*'By claw and tooth, from root to thorn,
The Old Oak's grove, to wildlings sworn.'*

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text: *The mural shows druids claiming the grove in the name of the Old Oak - Silvanus, god of nature.*

PAD_UnlockWithCirclet.speaker: Player
PAD_UnlockWithCirclet.text: It's opened. I wonder what's back there.
PAD_UnlockWithCirclet.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Slightly understated since it could be a tense situation.

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text:
*'The towers seized, the battle done,
the moonrise broke the Darkest One.'*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text: *You recognise the mark of the dark goddess Shar on the broken helmet. This army marched in her name.*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Shadowheart
FrescoVictory.text: So many dead. Sent to the Nightsinger's embrace.

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text: *'Moonrise' must be a reference to Shar's divine sister, Selûne.*

VB_ObtainedReward.speaker: Player
VB_ObtainedReward.text: The glaive the druid's notebook mentioned. Its owner thought it was cursed...

session_synopses.VB_UnlockedStudy: |You retrieved the missing wolf rune, placed it back in the socket, clicked on the 4 runes and now the wolf statue is sinking down in the ground, revealing spiral stairs.|
session_synopses.FrescoFoundingGrove: Player is examining a mural on the wall of the Druid's Grove, depicting its foundation.
session_synopses.PAD_UnlockWithCirclet: Played only once, ever.This player opened one of the stone slabs in the secret library using the magic circlet.
session_synopses.FrescoVictory: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting a group of druids standing over a vanquished army. Pass a test to realise that the army was the army of Shar - a Dark Goddess.
session_synopses.VB_ObtainedReward: Player finds a glaive in a locked room. Reading a nearby book you might learn it was taken from the Shadow cursed lands by Halsin, who found it was infused with dark power. (It does have a special power - the glaive deals 1d6 extra necrotic damage to characters UNLESS they're standing in sunlight.)

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: Don't do this to me, Kanon.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Wotcher messin' with my cage for?
Caged.context: NodeContext: spoken when player tampers with her cage while she's locked up - curious

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Didn't expect to see a drow in here. Did the boss lady send you to rescue me?

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: You're not mates with the tiefs, are you? You need to get back to your own people before you go soft.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: The lady that sent me here's the cruellest drow I ever met. You could learn a thing or two from her.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Get me outta here, and I'll take you to meet her and the rest of my tribe.

Friend.speaker: Memnos
Friend.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: That goblin is in my debt - should prove useful one day.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: Or it'll come back to haunt us.
PAD_Freed.context: NodeContext: Karlach: A little naive but sincere.

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses.Caged: Character is caged for this entire dialogue If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
session_synopses.PAD_Freed: This VB plays after Sazza was escorted outside of the Grove.The dialog may play with one or two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who helped her escape.Speaker 2 is an accompanying party member, and as such may have an opinion on the issue.

AD_Debate.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate.text: I still can't believe Master Halsin is dead.

AD_Debate.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate.text: I can. He let in outsiders, then rushed off - he's made one mistake after the other.

AD_Debate.speaker: Loic
AD_Debate.text: What will we do without a First Druid?

AD_Debate.speaker: Marcoryl
AD_Debate.text: Exactly as we have always done - tend this grove. Nothing has changed.

002.speaker: Marcoryl
002.text: You may have won over Kagha, but I'm not so easily swayed.

003.speaker: Loic
003.text: Shadow Druids... To think we were rotting from within. I'm sorry. I need a moment.
003.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: Add Shadow Druid Flag. Reaction for after the player exposed the Shadow druid plot. I don't know if he'll be part of the druids who fight alongside Sagha (I don't know if all pro-sagha druids do). But this works both if Sagha got convinced and if she's dead.NodeContext: They just discovered that their boss was being influenced by an evil organisation.

session_synopses.AD_Debate:
Situation: M and L are discussing the state of the grove. Scenario 1) Child has died. A child has died at the hands of Sagha - the druid they support. L is shaken by the encounter and having doubts. M believes the punishment was just and is even inspired to do similar to the other tieflings in the grove.

2) Child escapes. M is frustrated that the child fled 'without punishment'. He believes the other tieflings will take this as a sign that they can be walked all over. L isn't so sure.
session_synopses.002: A very condescending and somewhat objectionable druid servant. He believes the tiefling refugees hiding in the grove have brought chaos and would gladly be rid of them, even if turning them away would doom them.
session_synopses.003: An elderly druid who would like nothing more than for the player to leave. Depending on what the player has done, he will be civil about it, but still incistent. If the child has died, he is openly hostile.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: I've heard enough of your chatter. I don't need more.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Oh. Umm... okay, I'll... keep it.
InHideout.context: NodeContext: The player refused his gift, saying it's junk

VB_PlayerWarnings.speaker: Player
VB_PlayerWarnings.context: NodeContext: wondering, a little bit in awe.

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.VB_PlayerWarnings: AD played when the player gets close to the harpy situation, warning them that something is amiss.
session_synopses.AD_GnomeCharmed: The tiefling kid has been charmed, and is being controlled by a beautiful song that beckons him forth, promising everything will be all right if he follows.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerUncharmed: AD played when player wakes up from being charmed by the harpies.

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: Have you heard? Scouts have just reported the goblins have been neutralised. The way is clear!

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: The others are gathering near the gate - come on!

session_synopses.Transition: This scene plays for people in the Druid Grove if another player kills the Goblin Leaders away from the Grove.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: Lives are at stake, and the cowards only care about their bloody rituals!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Spoken to the player re; the druids, who are still relatively close.

AD_ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
AD_ParentsScene.text: Step back - you sully our holy ground!

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: This place ain't so special. Why were the druids so protective of it?
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: Looks like the druids have eased off some. Small mercies.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Calmer than before - druids have stood down

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

Parents.speaker: Player
Parents.text: Kagha will release her soon, just hold on.

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter will be released 'soon'. Snapping and frustrated. You need to see here and you're terrified for her.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Hang on, love. This'll be over soon enough - we just gotta wait a bit longer.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Thank you. Sincerely. I don't know what we'd do without our little girl.
Parents.context: NodeContext: Turning to the player - love and gratitude in your voice.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: All Arabella wanted to do is help. But you and half the grove stood by and let her die - alone.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: Get out of my sight. For your own good.

Guard1.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1.text: Your companion vouched for you, but you're being watched. Respect our grove.
Guard1.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.Protester1: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsScene: (script comment: it is repeated, but I don't want it to be culled out)This occurs as the player approaches the scene. Locke and Marrick are arguing with two druid guards - trying to get in. Their daughter is inside but they are being denied entrance.Tensions are high and voices are raised. This is a tense exchange.
session_synopses.Protester3: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.Protester2: Angry demonstator. Part of a mob of irate tieflings who have gathered to protest the druids' actions. They fear the druids will place them in danger in order to protect the grove. Later, the druids might stand down and the tiefling might remark upon this in a calmer tone.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
session_synopses.Parents: Locke and Marrick are parents who are scared for their daughter Arabella. Taken by the druids, Arabella is appearing in court on accusations of thievery. Her parents have no doubt that she is guilty but they are terrified for her and trying to get to her.Marrick hides his concern throughout with anger and threats of violence. It is easier to deal with fury then it is to temper fear. Locke is more level-headed but no less close to violence. Marrick and Locke are both at the entrance to the inner grove and the sacred pool and have just been denied entry.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.SoloParentA: This is for the edgecase in which one of the parents has died. In this case - Locke, the husband survives. In the first scenarion he rewards and thanks the player for saving his daughter's life - lamenting briefly on their lives without Arabella's mother.In the second, he learns that Arabella has died. He is overcome with grief and rage at losing both his wife and daughter.
session_synopses.Guard1: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: The Shadow Druids are taking over - the circle is overdue some change.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

PAD_KidDied.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied.text: The snake killed that girl in front of everyone. Is this grove worth a dead child?

PAD_KidDied.speaker: Player
PAD_KidDied.text: The longer we stay here, the closer we come to reaching the same fate.
PAD_KidDied.context: NodeContext: Karlach just watched some druids accidentally kill a tiefling girl. She's stunned.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

AD_LeaderPersuaded.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded.text: How could I be so weak?

AD_LeaderPersuaded.speaker: Kagha
AD_LeaderPersuaded.text: Dearest Rath. You deserved so much better.

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *You consider the Rite of Thorns. A rare art, plucked from illicit domains.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Player
SelfReflection.text: Think back to your teachings. What are the rite's perils?

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *When the prayer ends, vines curl upwards from the earth and thorns sprout forth.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *Those within are isolated and those without, rejected. Isolation breeds violence. Few circles survive it.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *There is more to Kagha's tale. The grove must hide her secrets.*

AD_OpposedPacified.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified.text: So much death. So little justice.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Player
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Halsin is dead. I thought you should know.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: He turned his back on the circle to stumble after the past. How fitting that it's consumed him.

LeaderPostGoblins.speaker: Kagha
LeaderPostGoblins.text: Well. A broodmother looks forward, never back. I am First Druid now. And I will keep my children safe.

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.PAD_KidDied: Reaction after Arabella, a tiefling child, is killed by the druid Kagha's serpent in the grove. Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who was in the dialog and had opportunity to stop it. (May have tried and failed or simply refrained from acting)Speaker 2 is an accompanying character, they may have an opinionated line regarding the outcome according to their own beliefs.
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.AD_LeaderPersuaded: Plays ONLY if Rath died in the combat against the Shadow Druids! If Rath is alive, He and Kagha have an AD together instead. In all cases, Kagha is mourning, shocked and repentant at what she has done.
session_synopses.SelfReflection: Following Kagha's dialogue, if druid player asked about the rite and has not already discovered the shadow druid connection, they experience a self-reflection. There is more to this tale; you should search Kagha's quarters. Journal entry to search her quarters appears.
session_synopses.AD_OpposedPacified: Plays after the "Denouncing Kagha" scene, when Kagha is dead. When she is alive, Rath and Kagha have an AD together
session_synopses.LeaderPostGoblins: Kagha's dialogue after the goblins' leaders are all dead and the grove enters the victory state.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: If it ain't the fearless goblin-slayer.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Aggressive, but not powerfully so. He's not a friendly guy.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: You sure you want to be seen with me? I ain't exactly popular with this lot.
node_data.context: NodeContext: with a grimace - 'this lot' refers specifically to the tiefling refugees who are nearby but not necessarily in-shot, but he's grumpy enough that it also refers to just about everybody in the world

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You could try to be a little friendlier.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Thanks, mum. Now please do feck off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Thick with sarcasm

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Charming. I can see why the locals like you so much.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Them devils ain't local - they're refugees. Fella who runs this place offered 'em shelter.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm not local either - got a problem with that?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Fair enough. I ain't tryin' to start the shite with you, anyway. Been a day.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Semi friendly, semi-punchable

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: First, I lost half my crew in some godforsaken temple.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Note the plural "gods" in "godsforsaken".

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Now I'm gonna take the blame for leading the goblins here, and losing track of the bloody druid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He knows these things are his fault, but he's sulking and petulant about it

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where did the goblins come from?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: They chased us all the way from the ruins we were poking around in.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Sounds like you were looking for trouble.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: We was looking for a relic. Had a contract to find it, and the fella who runs this place came along on the job with us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: petulant

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Didn't work out, though. Goblins got him when we were turning tail. He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You ran away from a few goblins?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Wasn't no few goblins, mate. There's an entire hive of 'em. Contract failed to mention that part.

session_synopses: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.

AD_LookingForInstrument.speaker: Alfira
AD_LookingForInstrument.text: No, no, no. It was right here.
AD_LookingForInstrument.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

AD_StartingOver.speaker: Alfira
AD_StartingOver.context: NodeContext: Player has convinced her to start from scratch with the song. Doubts herself. Hates what she's working on. Dejected.

AD_Dejected.speaker: Alfira
AD_Dejected.context: NodeContext: She has 'lost' her instrument (player stole it). You are on the brink of tears, feeling lost and ashamed - you wanted to write a song for your teacher, and now you never will. You feel like a failure.

session_synopses.AD_LookingForInstrument: The bard is looking for her instrument in the vicinity of her playing spot.
session_synopses.AD_StartingOver: AD that plays after the bard has been told to start over. She is holding her lute. Not plucking it occasionally but not really playing.
session_synopses.AD_Dejected: Dejected/crying because her instrument was stolen or smashed by a player.

AD.speaker: Guex
AD.text: Again. Swing-and-swing-and-parry-and-nnnGGH!
AD.context: NodeContext: Concentrating, exerting himself - then flubbing it.

AD.speaker: Guex
AD.text: And again.

AD.speaker: Guex
AD.text: Swing, swing-and-unGH!

session_synopses.AD: Guex, a tiefling refugee, practices his swordplay on a wooden dummy. If he received pointers from the player, his efforts are improved. Otherwise, he stuggles.

PAD_Comment.speaker: Player
PAD_Comment.text: Looks like the ritual worked. The whole grove is walled in.
PAD_Comment.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Sad. tieflings trapped inside.

PAD_Attack.speaker: Player
PAD_Attack.text: It'd take an age to hack through all this.

session_synopses.PAD_Comment: This VB plays when players first see the results of a druid ritual: indestructible vines have enveloped the entire grove, sealing it off from the outside world. Players cannot get past them to the grove within.
session_synopses.PAD_Attack: This VB plays when players attack the indestructible vines that have enveloped a druid's grove.

HalsinDiedBearform.speaker: Narrator
HalsinDiedBearform.text: *The corpse before you is no longer that of a bear, but an elf - albeit a large one. Curious.*

session_synopses.HalsinDiedBearform: If Halsin is killed in bear form in the Wolf Pens and the party knew about Halsin, the companions comment on the fact that the large dead elf who can turn in to a bear was probably the druid they were sent to find. Oops.

session_synopses.WolfPens_AD_WorgOutsideCage: AD which is played when the worgs are outside the cage

AD_Goblin_001_Combat.speaker: Warrior Sul
AD_Goblin_001_Combat.text: Bet them guts are nice and juicy!

session_synopses.CINE_Statue_02: Cinematic arena dialog to destroy a statue.

session_synopses.AD_DarkUrge: Dark Urge approaches the Roasting Dwarf

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I'm so stupid. How could I have trusted her?
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Shake and horrified - you've just survived a near death experience.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: I almost gave that monster my child.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: The true horror of what you almost did is dawning on you - giving your child to a hag.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: It was part of the deal. For him.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Horror and grief as you recount your deal

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: My husband. She was going to bring him back. Bring Connor back to life.

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: What would have happened to your child?

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: Ethel promised to raise the child - teach them magic. Give them a good life. That's a damn sight better than I can do.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: You made this deal with child in mind. You will NOT be judged for wanting your child to have a better life.

session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Lair: This occurs after the hag fight. Mayrina is in one of two states. In the top she is horrified, shaken and trying to calm herself. She can't believe she almost made a deal with the hag and explains her deal to the player.In the second, she is FURIOUS with the player for ruining her deal. And leaves angry with them (unless you tell her about ethel planning to eat her child.)

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Blood everywhere. This camp was ambushed.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: No ordinary creature did this. Redcaps ripped the place to pieces.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for HAG. The player comes across a wrecked campsite that is covered in blood and clearly abandoned. Passing a Nature check reveals the culprits to be redcaps.

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Ungh... what... argh... what in the bloody hells is going on?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I - I remember that bit. I think. She...  turned me to stone. Because of the Bite! Of course.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Your memories are coming back. You remember going to the hag for a spell to save you.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I can't believe you fixed it. How did you cure me?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: . You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Well - yes. Why d'ya bloody think I'm here?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Player has asked about your disease and was it contagious. You're surprised and confused by the question.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Oh, no, no. Why - why did you remove the spell if ya couldn't fix me?!
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Panic ramps up, tinted by rage. You realise the player hasn't cured you of a horrible and contagious disease you have - they've condemned you to death.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as a presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You see the gallery, its walls lined with the hag's victims - their bodies and minds twisted beyond ruin.*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the gallery - the huddled victim in the mirror, the headless victim, the vacant bleeding eyes sockets

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Dead.text: How did you end up in the cave?

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: Trapped... between two choices... I made a deal... to see my fate...

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: ... but all I saw... was death... so I ran... ran here...

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead.text: Why did you go to the hag?

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: My family took her... my baby girl...

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: Told Ethel... never wanted... to see them again... she... took my eyes...

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a cage. You're scared but determined - yelling for the fighting to stop

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *The mirror glints in the light - the screams from within now silent.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.
And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

AD_VictimSign_001.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: Think you're a person because you're walking on two feet? Adorable.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Demir, Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - fear in your voice.

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

Victim_001_Dead.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead.text: Got sick... had to leave home... leave my children...

Victim_001_Dead.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_Dead.text: ... wonder what... they look like now...

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: No... No. Don't look. Mustn'tlook. Mustn'tsee.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: No... No. Don't look. Musn'tlook. Musn'tsee.
Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting on the ground, knees up, hands moving from across knees to face as you rocking back and forth, severely traumatised and trying to hide from the worldNodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. This is quite a disturbing scene - you're clearly traumatised but trying to hold it together initially. Speaking and muttering to yourself (the image you are trying not too look at is your own corpse - rotten and broken), You are not looking at the player.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.text: I see it - what's to come.
Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Shot of mirror.  His reflection stares back.|NodeContext: Quickly muttered - not looking at player.

AD_HagAttacksCage.text: You want the girl so bad? Fine. Have her roasted!
AD_HagAttacksCage.context: NodeContext: You've just set the cage holding a pregnant woman prisoner on fire. Middle of a fight. Laugh and a vicious smile.

AD_DoubleDied.context: NodeContext: You have created illusions of yourself. The player is attacking you - but getting the illusion instead. You're laughing and taunting them - rubbing it in their face that they can't find you.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.PutOnMask: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_001: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
session_synopses.Victim_001_Dead: Dialogue with dead hag victim using Speak with Dead. He's relieved to be 'free' at last after haivng lived a life petrified/ afflicted with Laduguer's Bite, a terrible illness.
session_synopses.Victim_003:
