This victim was cursed to see the future by the hag. In his initial dialogue, he is SEVERELY traumatised - sitting down, knees up, peeking out between his arms. He should sound quite disturbed, as if his sanity has long since deserted him.

He doesn't look at the player until halfway through the dialogue. When he looks up, he believes the player to be a monster of nightmares - a mindflayer. This is a terrifying moment for the player, as they are fighting a parasite in their head that will cause them to turn into a mindflayer.

In his dialogue in which he's met the player but has survived the hag, his gift is gone - but once he realises the player is the monster he saw before, he runs - terrified. 

In his post hag dialogue he is saddened and clearly traumatised by his time with the hag - and the thought of the life he could have led.
session_synopses.AD_HagAttacksCage: These are fired during the fight with the hag. The first occurs when Mayrina's cage is set on fire, the second if she dies.
session_synopses.AD_DoubleDied: This fires during the fight with the hag. She's created doubles of herself and the player has attacked the double - missing her. She's taunting them.

TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.speaker: Narrator
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.text: *The goblin appears annoyed. It might be best to leave the prisoner alone.*
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Assault - gobs don't know about Den

session_synopses.TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom: Crime dialogue when a random goblin sees you hurting or killing Liam.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captiveNodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Sharper stones might cut through all that fur.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: Triumphant hump of excertion

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear whimpers as the stone hits him and looks at us directly, as if begging us to help it.

Halsin_Following.speaker: Player
Halsin_Following.text: Gesture for him to wait here.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.text: Get rid of them. Release me.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speak with animals lineInternalNodeContext: Speak with animals lineNodeContext: Speak with animals line

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.GroupDialogWithBear: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his bear form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage: A  bear who is imprisoned in the goblin camp. This bear is in fact the arch druid Halsin, though he doesn't reveal this to us until after he's out of his cage, even if we use Speak with Animals.

node_data.speaker: Rozzak
node_data.text: If you're here to help with the raid, talk to her ladyship. She's in charge.
node_data.context: NodeContext: deferential to 'her ladyship'. Dismissive toward us

session_synopses: Impatient goblin. Planning a raid with a drow, and he's deferring to her.

Spiders_CantSpeak.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_CantSpeak.text: *The spider seems poised to attack, but she hesitates, tapping her claws as if trying to communicate.*

Spiders_CantSpeak.speaker: Narrator
Spiders_CantSpeak.text: *You, however, are unable to speak. Her hesitation turns to impatience.*
Spiders_CantSpeak.context: NodeContext: Starts combat, the spider lunges.

Adventurer.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
CapturedGoblin.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution

session_synopses.Spiders_CantSpeak: Two giant spiders trap the player. Normally, the player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above. But in this case, the player is unable to speak and can't make their case.
session_synopses.Adventurer: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin: Sazza after she survives 'execution' the the spider pit. Pleading to the player to let her leave (which she will if she's not killed)

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: But goblins give you no pause?

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Someone needs to keep an eye on these buggers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: I don't make a habit of questioning the Absolute. Now quiet.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

EyeMurder_AD.speaker: Dror Ragzlin, Erna, GROUP_Goblins, Nightwarden Minthara, Yerle
EyeMurder_AD.text: 'S dead. Spied one too many bowels movin', I expect.
EyeMurder_AD.context: NodeContext: Satisfied contempt - the goblins hated this creepy thing and are glad it's dead

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Crusher
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX : The goblin bends over and kisses the player's foot
DrunkGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Needs to be mocaped InternalNodeContext: Needs to be mocaped

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX: All surrounding Goblins cackle as the drunk goblin point out the player kissed his feet

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX: All surrounding Goblins menacingly cackle as the drunk goblin threatens the player

session_synopses.EyeMurder_AD: A one-time line triggered when a goblin guard spots the dead scrying eye.

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin raises a club, ready to hit the adventurer, but then notices the player and stops.NodeContext: He's torturing an adventurer and getting sadistic pleasure from this.

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: You again? Wanna join 'im this time?

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: Why are you still torturing him?

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: Some other git found the grove before we did. Made us look real stupid, 'e did.
Torture.context: NodeContext: a little sour at the memory

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: So now we're makin' sure this lad regrets not tellin' us.
Torture.context: NodeContext: deriving sadistic pleasure from this.

session_synopses.Torture: One of the goblins is torturing a prisoner, either to find out where the grove is, or just because he wants to. The player can try to get rid of him - if Shadowheart is present, she gives some advice on how to do so. If Shadowheart is the avatar, she has unique options criticising the goblin's techniques.
session_synopses.Spike_Dead: Speak with dead: goblin torturer in camp. Non-Wyll version.

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage.text: So I see. Do you have plans for this 'pigeon'?

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Keep him safe. Listen to him coo. 'Til I gets hungry or some such.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: explaining as if to an idiot

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: You there! A friendly face. You haven't the looks of one of these cultists about you, no sir!

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: I'm in no hurry to take my turn on that spit out front. Perhaps you'd be so kind as to unlock this cage?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: How did you end up in this place?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Curiosity, my friend. It didn't benefit the cat, but it's the foundation of my career.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Though I admit I've hit something of an impasse. Please - unlock my cell?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: All right - I'll get you out.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Bless you, my friend! I'll wait nicely, but please don't tarry!

session_synopses.Guard_AtCage: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.
session_synopses.Volo_InCage: Volo has been caught by the goblins and imprisoned. He has an invisbility potion he can use to escape once he's out of the cage, but he needs the player's help. He's a combination of desperate for help and his usal, confident self.

DuringPenance.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance.text: Come now, dear child. It is time to repent.
DuringPenance.context: NodeContext: Penance was interrupted. Player has returned to speak to Abdirak. Voice low and inviting as he wishes to continue the beating.

DuringPenance.speaker: Player
DuringPenance.text: What do you want me to do?
DuringPenance.context: InternalNodeContext: The penance didn't really start yet, the player wasn't hit yet.

DuringPenance.speaker: Abdirak
DuringPenance.text: Simply face that wall - and stay absolutely still.
DuringPenance.context: NodeContext: Authorative tone but also a warning. He wants to hurt the player but not badly, and not outside of his realm of control. Safety first!

Battlestation.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation.text: My penitent child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

session_synopses.DuringPenance:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.
session_synopses.Battlestation: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Brand looks good on you. Priestess reckons we should all be marked up before the next raid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: warm - sees us as allies

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Make sure whoever we're stickin' it to knows we're doin' it for the Absolute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: proud

session_synopses: Goblin is recently converted to new religion and eager to head out on a raid.

node_data.speaker: Brawler Gurd
node_data.text: Oh, bugger off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: "gotta stick to my work" delivered deferentially, 'bugger off' dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin preparing for a raid, at a distance from the party going on elsewhere in the camp. He's trying to keep his head down, getting on with his work.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Let me see what you have.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: Sorry - I don't want any trouble.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Hey, can I see yer brand? The priestess gave me one, and I think she did it wrong.
Goblin007.context: NodeContext: He has been branded (by choice) and his arm is badly burned. He's too drunk to care too much though

Goblin007.speaker: Player
Goblin007.text: Priestess? Is she a healer, too?

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Heh. Seen 'er carve more folk than she's cured. Still, she's a Chosen o' the Absolute now.

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Hold on. I was askin' you sumfin', wasn't I?
Goblin007.context: NodeContext: Drunk, trying to remember what they were talking about.

Goblin000.speaker: Devout Mezzka
Goblin000.text: Wanna play, yer honour? Krolla will get you started.

Goblin001.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Greetings, your most excellent drow-ness. What do you think of these breeches? Could be a new uniform.
DwarfOperator000.context: CinematicNodeContext: adjusting his new breeches, swaggeringNodeContext: He's adjusting his new breeches, impressed with his own fashion-sense

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator000.text: They look quite fetching on you.

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Proper stylish, ain't they? Nicked 'em off this dwarf we're cookin'.
DwarfOperator000.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself, talking about his new breeches

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: You find the ones who poisoned that beer, you bring 'em to me. I'll take their heads for free.

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: Poisonin' the only good thing in this dump...
Bugbear_Wanderer.context: NodeContext: grumbled, not really to the player.

GoblinKid002.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002.text: Stupid, dead bastard. Give him a good kickin' - he deserves it!
GoblinKid002.context: NodeContext: this kid is standing over - and insulting - the corpse of a dead adventurer, and gives it a kick as he speaks to us

GoblinKid002.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002.text: Yeah! Right in the gnashers! You're all right.
GoblinKid002.context: NodeContext: reacting to players kicking a corpse - cheering, and then being friendly

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Hey... hey! You ain't roundin' me up for no raid. No way. I'm DRINKIN'!
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: She's boozy and aggressive - especially if you try to stop her having another drink. Friendly as could be if you join her in a drink.

Goblin005.speaker: Player
Goblin005.text: You'll need to sober up before another raid.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Tha's wot I said! Too sozzled for slicin' folks.
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: Pleased to have the player's support

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: I'd sleep it off in the worg pens... but that place is a madhouse right now.

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin007: A somewhat zealous goblin eager to tell us about the mark that the Absolute's followers have branded onto their flesh
session_synopses.Goblin000: A goblin drinking at the festivities following a successful raid. Discusses the chicken chase game the goblins ar eplaying nearby as well as the general festivities.Not drunk yet - fairly relaxed.
session_synopses.Goblin001: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator000: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Wanderer: A very grumpy bugbear guard who'd rather be sleeping.
session_synopses.GoblinKid002: An unpleasant goblin kid, standing over and insulting the corpse of a dead adventurer. The adventurer killed his parents, but if players offer sympathy he'll mock them.
session_synopses.Goblin005: A drunk goblin who is trying to get out of doing any more raiding

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: I do not have time for interruptions from underlings.
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As she turns to you, her thoughts mingle with yours, a cold hand caressing your brain.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: the drow turns and looks at the player, studying themNodeContext: unnerved

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The chamber melts away to reveal a dark, endless nowhere. In it, you see a vision - the drow listens as a pale-eyed young woman whispers in her ear.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *One of those the voice spoke of. One of the Chosen. The vision fades away...*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: mindmeld with Minthara as narrator describes vision of Minthara with Orin

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: A True Soul in such a grotesque form? The Absolute has a place in Her heart even for darthiir.
node_data.context: NodeContext: disgusted - speaking to an elf player and has a hatred of them. 'darthiir' (dar-FEAR) is a derogatory term for an elf

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: Her heart is more generous than mine. Join my hunt, faerie. And obey me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: sinister - 'faerie' is a derogatory way of referring to the player's race (an elf)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Join you? I'm here to kill you.

node_data.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
node_data.text: You would dare...? Guards - to me!
node_data.context: NodeContext: player has threatened her - shocked by their bravery

session_synopses: The drow commander is a True Soul, sent to the goblin camp in order to instil some discipline in the goblins and lead their raids. She's already had one success - at the tavern - but the adventurers who infiltrated the goblin camp are her next targets. The Absolute believes they have something of value, and she must reclaim it. The players can tell her that the adventurers fled to the grove in which case she'll see the players as perfect candidates to help her infiltrate the place, having mistaken them for True Souls.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
node_data.text: Ain't you got sumfin' better to do?
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin who doesn't have a lot of respect or time for players who are bothering her while she's trying to mingle with her fellow raiders

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Ha! Look at where the Absolute's love got 'em. Dead!
Saved.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin was saved from the cage and his attackers are dealt with.NodeContext: happy to see lots of dead heretics

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Thanks for breakin' me out. Gonna find me a new tribe. One that appreciates the old ways.

session_synopses.Saved: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage. He thanks players after they save him.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oi! What's the bloody ruckus out there?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and on-guard - she's heard a great deal of noise outside and you, a stranger, have just stumbled in

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll be asking the questions.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: Oh! B-beg pardon, True Soul! At y'service, of course.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Alarmed - she's just spoken sharply to someone who can kill her without a second thought.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Who's in charge around here?

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: We follow the Absolute and them She speaks through.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: At first we thought it were just Priestess Gut and Boss Ragzlin. Then the drow came along.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Explaining how things have changed.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: And... you and all now, I reckon. Go ahead, please - I'm sure you're expected.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hesitant, respectful - reminding herself that you're an important part of this new order.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
node_data.text: The Absolute is gatherin' us all together. For something big, I reckon.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Anticipation, confidence that their god has big plans for them

session_synopses: This goblin guard is aggressive and self-important. She's been tasked with keeping drunkards out and is taking to her small responsibility like a little tyrant, but will immediately roll over if the player convinces her of their authority.

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *A longing for small spaces, stone walls hugging close. Confining. Comforting.*

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *There is a light here, in the tight space beneath the floor. Secret things that shine.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_002: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp - we can learn of a puzzle hidden in the floor.

Guard.speaker: Warrior Plig
Guard.text: Steal somethin' or act the bollocks, will ya? I'm itching to throw someone in the brig. It'll be fun. I promise.
Guard.context: NodeContext: plig wants the player to act out so she can throw them in jail

PAD_TunnelBlocked.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelBlocked.text: Still blocked - but should be easy enough to clear.

session_synopses.Guard: Warrior Plig is a goblin on patrol around the wolf pens in the goblin camp. She's bored and wishing for some action.
session_synopses.PAD_TunnelBlocked: The player has pulled the body from the tunnel in the goblin prison, but it's still blocked by debris. The player can attack it if they can do enough damage (vulnrable to Force damge), are small enough to get good levrage, or shapeshifted into a badger. This AD plays to inform the player the way is still blocked and to hint at the solution.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: So yer followin' me? Think yer intimidatin' now?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: I ain't scared. I'll claw yer eyes out if you come any closer.

FistFight.speaker: Crusher
FistFight.text: Wait! I - I yield! I yield!
FistFight.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin is on the floor, speaking up at you. (Custom Scene for Goblin on the floor)NodeContext: Very panicked. They were in a fight he thought he'd win, but he's losing.

session_synopses.AtSecludedPlace: Goblin is standing on the bridge, outside the Goblin Camp.
session_synopses.FistFight: We defeated the drunk goblin in a fight he started. He yields before we can kill him. He's lying on the ground.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Nrog
node_data.text: Priestess burned ya, then? Thought I smelled somethin' tasty cookin'.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffs player before delivering line.NodeContext: Sniffs at player again before delivering line. Tone is mocking but friendly.

session_synopses: This goblin is standing guard inside temple - he's a little more relaxed than his zealous companion. Offers 'beginners' advice to player. As hostile as any other goblin if you try to pass without his superior's permission.

Goblin_002.speaker: Sharp-Eye Crub
Goblin_002.text: You're either with the Absolute or against her. Ain't no in-between.

session_synopses.Goblin_002: One goblin announced the blade of frontiers has no change against the Absolute!

Cellar.speaker: True Soul Gut
Cellar.text: What are you doing in here?
Cellar.context: InternalNodeContext: Not chained character tries to talk to the priest while he is in his roomNodeContext: startled, angry

Cellar.speaker: True Soul Gut
Cellar.text: I'm gonna split your head open!

session_synopses.Cellar: the priestess reacts to seeing the player when they've either escaped her clutches or trespessed in her private chapel

Attack_AssaultCustom.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Attack_AssaultCustom.text: You defile the Absolute's name. Boys!

session_synopses.Attack_AssaultCustom: Goblin king sees player commit a crime and initiates attack.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking aboutNodeContext: SFX only

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Kneel down - you won't hurt him.

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *You notice a shiver run through his feathered coat - fear, a desperate longing for the safety of his nest.*

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *But his mother is gone - taken. All that's left are these creatures.*

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Offer him your hand. He can follow your scent to your camp in the wilderness.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub tilts head, considering player, then backs away and leaves.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record.

session_synopses.Owlbear: This owlbear has been captured by the goblins. It is a cub and has been tormented by the goblins. In this dialog the player can reassure it, guide it to safety, or encourage it to attack the goblins. If the player has convinced his captors to release him, they can invite him to their camp. The owlbear refuses - but will show up later on his own.
session_synopses.GameOver: The Chase is over, the commentator tells the player to approach her.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Druk
node_data.text: Another outsider come to see the boss?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing the player up - sounds bored of all the newcomers

node_data.speaker: Warrior Druk
node_data.text: Mind yer manners, now - or he'll throw ya in the pit.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking, warning - he'd love to throw you in

session_synopses: A goblin who guards a pit of giant spiders. To most players, he's rude, but to drow he's deferential and grovels, trying to please them.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Well! Look who's gettin' dragged back. And by such high company! How badly did you mess up?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Can it! I know something Ragzlin will want to hear.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is ragging on Olak. They don't like each other.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: I been in some druids' grove. This one sprang me. Now move over, so I can tell Ragzlin myself!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is arguing on the player's behalf to the hostile Olak.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Hold on. Where are the raiders?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak is full of gleeful malice.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Ragzlin's drow friend won't be happy to hear that.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: She'll be happy enough when I tell her where them looters is holin' up. Let me through.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Hard 'g' on ranga. Sazza's pride is wounded but she hates Olak, so doesn't want to show it.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Go on. I ain't gonna hold up a drow.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow True Soul know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Guard003.speaker: Tracker Bal
Guard003.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Fallback node. RElatively friendly!

Backup003.speaker: Warlock Tud
Backup003.text: Lookin' at a future True Soul, you are. Boss Ragzlin says I'm next in line!

Backup003.speaker: Wyll
Backup003.text: Boss Ragzlin, eh? Must be the goblin in charge.
Backup003.context: NodeContext: Wyll overheard gpoblin mention Ragzlin, pronounced "RAGS-lin." That means his target is close.

Guard002.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: She gestures to himself and to you, as if to ask, 'go on, tell me, are you part of my clan?'

Trespassing.text: Oi, stand back! Where'd you come from?
Trespassing.context: NodeContext: Affronted, player is trespassing and has been spotted

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin:
If the player released the captured goblin in Halsin's den, the CG will be waiting for the player at the checkpoint. When the player starts the dialog with the main guard at the checkpoint (or gets closer to him) and the CG is at the checkpoint, this dialog is shown. After this dialog, the CG leaves the checkpoint and the main guard gets his normal dialog back.

 Olak and Sazza have a very antagonistic relationship, ripping each other to shreds.
session_synopses.Guard003: A goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Squirrely, animalian type. Friendlier than most, but not extremely friendly.
session_synopses.Backup003: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Very stoked about the Absolute.A little drunk. A hiccup or two wouldn't be out of place :)
session_synopses.Guard002: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
session_synopses.Backup001: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.
session_synopses.Trespassing: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the crest she bears - the winged serpent of the Zhentarim.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera should show Crest of Zhentarim she is wearing

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
node_data.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do you know about Moonrise Towers?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: All I need to - there's an awful lot of folk flowing that way, and coin is sure to follow.
node_data.context: NodeContext: She doesn't share your curiosity - but she sees the opportunity for business in Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Might have to find my faith and see this Absolute for myself, eh?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Speculative, joking - she'll happily pretend to be relgious if it means making a deal

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Still some deals to be done here, though - you want to trade, or what?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Eyeing you up, bringing you back to the topic at hand

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Let me see your wares.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Pleasure.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Affable.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Huk
node_data.text: Hmph.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He waves you off, while he keeps looking at the goblin boss.

session_synopses: This goblin is watching his boss in awe and doesn't want to be sisturbed. When he speaks, he does so in hushed tones.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Bez
node_data.text: Unless you like big, bristlin' hairy legs, I wouldn't go down there, mate. Tha's the spider pit.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Terrified of the spiders she's guarding. Acts very deferential with the drow, but is honest about her fear with other races.

session_synopses: This guard is watching over a pit containing two giant spiders. She is afraid of them and says as much to the player (unless player is a drow, who venerate spiders)

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Roo
node_data.text: You a True Soul then, eh? The Absolute'll make me one too.

session_synopses: Goblin in camp, jealous that he isn't a true soul yet.

Tiny.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Tiny.text: You are no goblin. Who are you? Answer me or die.

Tiny.speaker: Player
Tiny.text: Just a visitor. I mean you no harm.

Tiny.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Tiny.text: You don't mean harm. I do.

session_synopses.Tiny: A giant spider confronts players when they enter the pit where it is captive. It is hostile, but can be persuaded not to attack.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Gnat
node_data.text: True Soul, eh? Figured the Absolute had standards.

session_synopses: Goblin absolutely enamoured with his own king and less impressed with the player.

Goblin.speaker: Brawler Rancer
Goblin.text: Tha's the that of it. Heh!

session_synopses.Goblin: He's super drunk and is talking to himself more than to you.

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

CINE_HammerStrike.text: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.
session_synopses.CINE_HammerStrike: A party member pulled the lever that activates the hammer strike.NOTES:- To be replaced by combat cams.- For now, we're ignoring the scenario where the lever was activated some other way than using it.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse.text: I will take the lives of those who took yours.

session_synopses.LootingCorpse: Player having a contemplative moment while observing the corpses of dead gnomes.

PAD_OnPlatform2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnPlatform2.text: Platform's covered in rust - must be older than bonedust.

session_synopses.PAD_OnPlatform2: The player steps on a rusted platform in Grymforge suspended by four chains. (An elevator, really.)

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Angry trills and tremors shake your skull - cries of anguish to its mycelic god.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.text: Hardly the time for a repast. Later, maybe...
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Spoken to self. Lightly chastising herself for attempting to eat a mushroom at an inopportune moment.

session_synopses.PAD_RefuseNobleStalk: Shadowheart states that she doesn't want to eat the Noblestalk or is not ready for it yet.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *An object catches your eye - a lantern, it seems, though no light flickers within.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: | NEEDS CONTEXT |

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the lantern in more detail.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Nothing about the lantern strikes you as unusual.*

session_synopses: Player finds a broken Moonlantern while looting Nere's body. Companions reflect on it - either unsure what it is or discussing the fact that it's a Moonlantern, which would help them traverse a cursed land. If it wasn't broken.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Furious. How dare a wretched flower take what is yours?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic is gone, replaced by fury. You and your powers are one - this will be temporary.*

session_synopses.IVB_Aura_Sorcerer: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Kettel
node_data.text: One step closer an' you're fish food.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Hurk
node_data.text: Been a long day for all of us, so don't try nothin' funny.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Dunnol
node_data.text: Get yourself set before that powder goes boom.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is shouting at the gnomes.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I heard a gnome escaped. Tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No, no... there must be some mistake. Right, Lunkbug?

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Damn it, Laridda. We've lost enough of us. I'm not losing Beldron, too.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Laridda.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hear me out - our friends are trapped in the cave-in. And I know a way to get them out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda shakes her head at Lunkbug, warning him not to say anything. Lunkbug ignores her and turns to you.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Bug, please. True Soul Nere will - you know what he'll do.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pleading for her friend not to tell.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That sounds like quite the drama. I can't wait to watch.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: What? No. Lunkbug, you can't.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: I've... I've got no choice, Laridda. We have to chance it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: A few days back, there was a... a scene. Our friend Philomeen, she's a sapper. Set off a blast and ran off.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: We set a spot for hiding if someone found trouble. I'll mark your map.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: If Philomeen made it, you'll find her there. She'll have the stuff to blow that tunnel wide open and get Beldron and the rest out.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Excellent. I can add Philomeen's head to my collection.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No! I told you, Bug.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Laridda - I...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: You better not harm a damned hair on her head.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: Sad more than angry.

session_synopses: Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is.This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Yes, True Soul?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: A few of your clanmates are plotting to kill Nere.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Let me guess - Brithvar and Kur. They've been a thorn in my arse since Nere hired us.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Ignore dumb and dumber. They'd jump down a well if they though there was gold at the bottom.

node_data.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
node_data.text: Nere can handle himself. Reason I joined - I know which way the lava flows.

FollowUp.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
FollowUp.text: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.

session_synopses: The duergar sergeant responsible for the camp while Nere is trapped. She's yelling at the gnomes and is considerably pissed off. After realising you are a True Soul, she asks you to help free Nere from the cave-in, and you can refuse or accept. You might turn in her missing boots if you have found them You can also ask about the gnome that escaped and the scrying eye.
session_synopses.FollowUp: The player sided with Nere, but Nere died in combat. Thrinn announces her plan: to travel to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

AD_BOOOALAppears.speaker: BOOOAL
AD_BOOOALAppears.text: CUT YOU BREAK YOU TASTE YOU!

PAD_MagicGone.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicGone.text: Not much of a god after all. Whatever power he had, it died with those creatures.
PAD_MagicGone.context: NodeContext: BOO-al (not pronounced with extra emphasis, its just how the local fish people stylize it)

session_synopses.AD_BOOOALAppears: This line plays when we force a creature to reveal itself by overwhelming it with bloodlust
session_synopses.PAD_MagicGone: This PAD triggers if/when the player kills all the Kuo-Toa and BOOOAL's magic disappates - the beat is 'he was no true god, his power came from those fish creatures'.

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: You'll want to speak with Gekh.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.

Leader.speaker: Brathwen
Leader.text: Hey! Get back with the others. Now.

session_synopses.Companion: Short dialogues with this character after you have your main dialogue with him. He doesn't talk much, hasn't been the same since a rock slide.
session_synopses.Leader: Short dialogues when i'm done doing the main 'looting' scene with this character.

node_data.speaker: Ward Magmar
node_data.text: Another round, Stickshit.
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: To Skickpit

Stickpit is collecting empty tankards from Magmar and PistleNodeContext: VO NOTE:Magmar should sound drunk

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Pisspot.
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: To Magmar

Stickpit walks off screen with both mugs

node_data.speaker: Ward Magmar
node_data.text: You flirt.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Skickpit

node_data.speaker: Ward Magmar
node_data.text: Now jump to it, or it's up the lift and straight to the shadows.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To SkickpitNodeContext: To Skickpit

session_synopses: Two surly duergar with foul mouths order a gnome slave around. Both should sound DRUNK, loud and obnoxious as they demand a refil from the gnome. Player can assert how they feel about the enslaving of the gnome.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spitting in between words, enraged

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I offer to parley, and he brings a spectator? Twit. Quite ruined my ambush.

Wizard.speaker: Player
Wizard.text: I'm more concerned with this 'twit' who set a spectator on you.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: Pah. A rival - a mere footnote to my legend. You should be more concerned with who I am.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I am Dhourn. Third son of House Ba'Tol, first rank evoker, and initiate of Gravenhollow's...
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)NodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: ... my crystal. My memory shard. Where is it?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: Rising panic as he can't find an item we stole from him.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: You think it clever to steal from a statue, do you?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: To us, with suspicion and fury

002.speaker: Petrified Drow
002.text: Gh'rack! A pity Dhourn cannot say the same.

002.speaker: Player
002.text: Did you pick a fight with that spectator?

002.speaker: Petrified Drow
002.text: I came here with the wizard Dhourn. He vowed to share his fortunes in exchange for protection.

002.speaker: Petrified Drow
002.text: A man called Xargrim stepped from the shadows. They argued until their words turned to screams. Xargrim summoned the spectator - and fled.

002.speaker: Petrified Drow
002.text: An unusual spectator at that, adept at petrification. I was... unprepared.

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.Wizard: Drow Wizard that has some info about the Adamantine Furnace.Paranoid after being petrified by the spectator.narrative feature: Used to kill his oponents and interrogate them afterwards (Disguise Self + Speak With Dead).
session_synopses.002: This drow was petrified by a spectator.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Meerna... Nere killed her. She's - she's really gone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Shael vuk. Death is too good for him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'shall VUK' Bastard

Saved.speaker: Welso
Saved.text: You've done so much, I hate asking for more. But you see more slavers? Burn them, skin them - make them hurt.

session_synopses: 'Welso's sister is trapped behind the rubble. He is panicked and scared - frantically trying to dig her out.
session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome worker on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*

Looted_Solo.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *You recognise the symbol of the Dark Lady - you know these uniforms.*
Looted_Solo.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player goes into a crouch, looks over the bodies

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *These people were Dark Justiciars, a reviled order within Shar's priesthood - one whose rite of entry includes killing a cleric of Selûne.*

session_synopses.Looted_Solo: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

AD_BeckonPlayer.text: To me! I shall guide thee.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*
Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?
Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!
Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Focus on this entity. What are its intentions?
Prithee, now is not the time for dreaming! Open thine eyes, fair fool!

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *You suddenly feel cheerful. Too cheerful - as if even the grimmest sight might make you laugh.*
Hehee - not all is well with thee. Such is the price of mine favours!

ResistMadness.speaker: Player
ResistMadness.text: What's happening? What are you doing to me?
Ha ha! This is the madness the Sharrans wrought. Whilst thou wearest me, so sharest thou my curse.

session_synopses.AD_BeckonPlayer: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.
session_synopses.EquipAmulet: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).
session_synopses.ResistMadness: Player has left the camp. A few moments later, they are overcome with an unnatural sense of cheer. If they fail the check, they will fall over in laughter every time they use the amulet's special power that day.The madness has several levels.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*cleanse the Rot*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

PAD_FoundRune.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRune.text: This is a Harper rune. There must be a stockpile nearby.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundRune: Party discovers a strange marking. They may or may not recognise it as a Harper symbol.

session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.
session_synopses.Spider02: Followup after the spiders have killed their sister Xanta for being disloyal.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well. You... did it!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Don't sound so surprised.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I don't know if you heard, but some of the Ironhand Gnomes - my friend Wulbren among them - have been taken prisoner in Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I know someone of your background would fit right in in that heart of horrors, but for others of us it's quite a frightening prospect.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Resolute but actually pretty frightened.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: No.
False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: No.
False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Won't be needing it, thank you!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Good bye, my misery's favourite companion.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And, erm, well... thank you.

session_synopses: If you saved Barcus from the windmill, you can meet him again in the underdark. He's been captured once again - this time by a band of duergar (who follow the Absolute, same as the goblins did previously). If you get rid of his captors, you can talk to him some more about his next steps. He's still keen on saving his friend, Wulbren.

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.

session_synopses.AdamantineGolemSpawn: After a party member opens the valve that pours lava out of on the forging platform, a golem climbs out of the pipes, attacking them.Note: The valve can be activated by (ranged) attacks and spells, so party member positioning is not guaranteed.Note 2: Party members who are not players can activate the valve.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.HiddenGnome: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.
session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Dry land. My guts'll stop churning now.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives and the captain and players disembark.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Greymon, you shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Spit it up, Morghal. Or you busy choking on that True Soul Nere's prick with Thrinn?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Drugh no. The twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
CampIntro.context: NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: That's the trouble - he got the gold on him. Thrinn's arm's falling off what with the gnome slaves she been beating.
CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Did I hear right? You keep gnomes as slaves?

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Easy to feed, fat thumbs for digging. Won't find none better.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: But your type got their uses. Let's get those meat-paws to work.

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: I am a True Soul. You will treat me with honour.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Your Twat-Soul chum owes us a load of coin. You want in? Pay the toll.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: I call it the True Soul special.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles creepily.NodeContext: Morghal smiles creepily.

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Fine - take this. Consider it a goodwill gesture. |XXX gold|

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: I'll be shagged to Shanatar. Shit's looking up.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Now go on, sergeant's above. Can't miss her - just follow the screams.

session_synopses.CampIntro: Another duergar greets you on the other side of the lake after sailingthere with captain Greymon.Both duergar are surly, but Morghal in particular. She is suspicious of Absolutists, but happy to take their coin. She should be gruff, and absolutely not listless. She tells you that Nere is trapped above.

002.speaker: Ward Pistle
002.text: You don't need nothing I've got.

001.speaker: Ward Magmar
001.text: Shove off. Just 'cause you offed Nere doesn't mean I'm sharing.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Alcohol - an odd vice for duergar, prone to triggering ancestral memories of brutal illithid enslavement.*

session_synopses.002: Surly female duergar, lazy and trying to live the good life using her gnome slave. This dialogue occurs after she and her companion have ordered the duergar around.
session_synopses.001: One-liner for duergar thug. He tells you to leave after speaking previously. You get a passive skill check that may relate how alcohol can cause bad memories for duergar, and then ask about it.

Hermit_Dead.speaker: Player
Hermit_Dead.text: You are in my power. I do not ask, I command.

session_synopses.Hermit_Dead: Filro is one of three drow rivalry wizards in the Underdark who was looking for the Adamantine Forge, but his long research, loneliness and effects of the Sussur Tree  turned him mad. He lives with the hook horrors pack now.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You stare into the eye. Your reflection stares back.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Smile and wave.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The scrying eye doesn't blink.*

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: There's more back there. Get them out, please!

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Get Beldron out of there. Please.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've got explosive powder. That should open the way.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Incredible news. Drop it near the cave-in and set it alight!

session_synopses: One-liner dialog in Ketheric City for a gnome working on the cave-in.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: I know this design - Shar's faithful wield crossbows like these.

session_synopses.PAD: The player realises that a crossbow found in Ketheric City is not Dueargar make. If they pass a history check, they recognise it as Sharran.

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: Nicely handled. Those rothé old sweethearts of yours or something?
Guard_002.context: NodeContext: The player did well, but duergar are rarely the complimentary types.

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: Pity I got to split you - that forge ain't for sharing.

Guard_002.speaker: Player
Guard_002.text: I calmed the rothé, and now you want me dead?

Guard_002.speaker: Grundril
Guard_002.text: You think we're letting you near that forge? You're as dumb as you are stupid.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: Fantastic work. You're a right master of beasts.

Guard_003.speaker: Morgya
Guard_003.text: But ain't no one but clan need to be using the forge back there - and we can't have you blabbing!

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Well look here - Nere's killer in the flesh. Make yourself useful, grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
Guard_001.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: That rubble needs clearing, and my patience is hanging on by an arse whisker.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Shouldn't be trouble for a brute like you.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Don't think I won't thrash you harder than the rothé.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Something's spooked the dumbshits. So stop your jawin', and get to workin'.

session_synopses.Guard_002: One of the duergar guards near some deep rothe that're being used as hauling animals. Gruff and grim. Little patience and less empathy.Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.Guard_003: A coarse and unempathetic duergar, one of three guarding some Deep Rothe (beasts of burden currently being used to clear rubble).Different reactions if:- animals are panicking;- animals are calm;- animals are dead (doesn't matter how);
session_synopses.Guard_001: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Incredible. Every rock, every jewel tells a story.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The most interesting secrets are alway lurking just under the surface.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can talk to Stonemason Kith to obtain some info on the city. The following VB is a reaction to the knowledge acquired in that dialog. For specifics, see UND_DuergarRebelMason_01.This will be anchored on the character who left the dialog but this is mostly reacting to an info dump, so all characters can be opinionated.

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

AD_GalePowerRestored.speaker: Gale
AD_GalePowerRestored.text: Ingenious use of the magic in the tower's floral core. Though not ingenius enough to outsmart Gale of Waterdeep.
AD_GalePowerRestored.context: NodeContext: His hypothesis proved correct. Respecting the ingenuity, but smug that he/the party was able to disable it

session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time
session_synopses.AD_GalePowerRestored: The Arcane Tower has been powered again.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Hums. Clicks. Harmonies. They drift through you like an unknown language.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Then, visions. Dark dwarves - duergar - chopping fungal tendrils with their axes.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*the dark intruders broke our peace. they killed our young*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*we laid waste to many. others remain*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You see another vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision can be a simple linear pose to pose transition, portraying a single action

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Kneel in submission. I mean no harm to you.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but insistent.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*the Rot festers. duergar remain. lakeward*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The sovereign's song halts as it measures your might.*

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I will reward. you cleanse the Rot. you destroy them*))

node_data.speaker: Sovereign Spaw
node_data.text: ((*I sense your resolve. you will find duergar invaders near lake's edge. cleanse the Rot. destroy them*))

session_synopses: Main dialogue with creepy myconid sovereign. He wants you to kill some duergar that are left from when they attacked these mushroom creatures. Myconids are part of a "circle", kind of a hive mind. They speak in visions, with music - all telepathically. This should be otherworldly and slightly disturbing.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: The eye's clobbered - good work. Time to bust Nere out and shred him.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any ideas on how I might do that?

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Bet her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Once Nere's out, we'll pound him to powder and take our dues.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

session_synopses.MyconidDrow_Dead: Xargrim is one of three drow wizards who was looking for the Adamantine Forge. Friends turned rivals, these wizards each compete to find the forge, trying to steal the knowledge of the others as they go. Xargrim ambushed one of his fellows and set a spectator on him, but the strain of the ritual killed him.

node_data.speaker: Restless Myconid
node_data.text: ((*we will find truth in dream*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: How peculiar. Smooth face, cobbled edges. They're a sign - they must be.
01.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stonemason Kith facing away from player, looking at rubble.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: A sundweller in these parts? Look here, my top-side friend - I need fresh eyes. And I doubt I'll find fresher.
01.context: CinematicNodeContext: The stonemason turns to you and addresses you directly.

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Fine. What should I be looking at?
