01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: The rock. The rubble. All of it, if I may be so bold.

01.speaker: Stonemason Kith
01.text: Take a look. Tell me what you see. And be thorough.

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Survey the area for unseen curiosities.

01.speaker: Narrator
01.text: *Several glassy stones stand out in the debris. Their borders are coated with tiny yellow crystals.*

01.speaker: Narrator
01.text: *The hottest of flames smoothed the stone and left sulphuric crystals behind. The fires of the Hells have touched Grymforge.*

session_synopses.01: Duergar looking at stonework. Gruff sounding but surprisingly sophisticated. He asks you to examine the stonework and responds with his interpretation based on what you tell him

01.speaker: Danna
01.text: Last time I trust a drow hoon.

02.speaker: Mirthis
02.text: Drugnin' Nere - glad you offed him. Ain't no one divides the clan and lives to tell the tale.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Shadows - thick as a duerro's skull. Sucks the breath right out of your lungs.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Go on up, if you fancy. Me? I'd sooner take a swim in the Darklake.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Player
Mutineers.text: Why would you think I'm a True Soul?

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: The stench - all you Twat-Souls got one. Some of us got a nose for it.

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_01.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_01.text: *The rothé chews slowly, its eyes drooping from exhaustion.*

LoyalFollowUp.speaker: Novice Grumm
LoyalFollowUp.text: Shit - True Soul Nere's nothing but grub-chow now.

Rothe_02.speaker: Elder Rothé
Rothe_02.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

HangedDrow_Dead.speaker: Executed Drow
HangedDrow_Dead.context: NodeContext: Jhaam is his name. Pronounced Zhahm.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.Rothe_01: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
session_synopses.LoyalFollowUp: Player has sided with Nere, but Nere and Thrinn are dead by the time combat is over. In that case, a duergar initiates dialogue and tells you his plans and you get to decide the gnomes' fate.
session_synopses.Rothe_02: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.
session_synopses.HangedDrow_Dead: Player finds drow corpse hanging in a cage in Grymforge. When you click on it you discover that it was a Harper who came here, and could get some foreshadowing about Last Light and the name Jaheira.
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

session_synopses.AtPier_02: Gruff duergar guard standing watch ovre the entrance to Ketheric City.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit. You did it.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grymforge is even more dangerous. Stay at your own peril.
False

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Down here I know what I'm dealing with. Up there, not so much. Got a better idea?

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: What now?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Take the lift to the surface.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Shit - up there? Forget it. I hear the land's cursed clear to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Go where you want. I've done enough for you.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: Damn it - just when I thought you half decent.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: I know a place, cross the lake. Should be safe.

node_data.speaker: Skickpit
node_data.text: You might be a shithead. But I'm grateful.

session_synopses: Skickpit has a foul mouth to match the duergar. He runs their errands for them and brings them drinks. You can ask if he wants freed, attack him, or leave him be.

session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Looking into the hole, you see only darkness. It's impossible to tell how deep it goes by sight alone.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hellooo?

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your call echoes as it plunges downward, before gradually fading away.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The call echoes down the hole.

node_data.speaker: Voice from the Deep Hole
node_data.text: *Growl.*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: This is the growl of an unseen creature deep down in the Underdark. Exactly what it is will remain a mystery, other than it sounds big, threatening and unappreciative of the player's noise-making.NodeContext: SFX only

session_synopses: A deep hole in the Underdark that you can click on and shout "Helloooooo" into, hearing an echo. Something growls from down below in response; if the player can speak with animals, you may get a disgruntled reply. The creature is unseen, but sounds large, aggressive and very unhappy at being disturbed.First speaker is added for ease of scripting. 2nd speaker is the creature.

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: ... stuck in Moonrise with a bunch of sadists. Poor bastards.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome foreman on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Mentions the other gnomes being kept at moonrise towers.

session_synopses.BottomFairyRingActivationCinematic: Cinematic dialog. Shows the activation process for a Fairy Ring.Before the dialogue: the player approaches an active (has vfx) fariy mushroom ring. The dialogue starts. The camera shows the ring and the player (or only the ring) and then rotats and looks down, at another fairy mushroom ring which is inactive, it has no vfx. The VFX activates for the bottom ring, emphasizing activation. End of the cinematic.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*smooth-flesh. you are like them*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Duergar faces appear before you, one by one, each twisted by zealous cruelty.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

DuergarBoatAtCave.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat sits in the water

DuergarBoatAtCave.text: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.
DuergarBoatAtCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the shore with the party on board.InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.

Boat.speaker: Narrator
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: ~Should share sequence with *A vessel wobbles on the lake's murky waters.*

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: First time using the boat, sailing to the camp

Boat.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player departs from the Myconid beach and pilots the raft out into the underground lake
~[EA: Treat this like it's propelled by sails, there is not rowing or special animations for this]
Boat.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player departs from the Myconid beach and pilots the raft out into the underground lake
~[EA: Treat this like it's propelled by sails, there is not rowing or special animations for this]

DuergarBoatAtCamp.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat floating in the water

DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: InternalNodeContext: Cinematic needs to be a few seconds, a single node. Just to establish we're going through a long journey from A to B.NodeContext: Party boards the boat. Player sees the boat sail for a few seconds from the Grymforge dock with the party on board.

session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCave: Dialogue when clicking on boat in cave to reach Grymforge. Player can stay or cross. This dialogue only appears once player has already been to Grymforge.
session_synopses.Boat: Raft dialogue. The player can decide either to sail somewhere or to walk away from the raft.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

node_data.speaker: Drar
node_data.text: This ain't a show. Go make yourself useful or get lost.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standign guard, loyal to The Absolute.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: If you're so eager for blood, Glut, then let me give it to you.

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: ((*who is it. what do they want. are we safe*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: Probe your memories. What magic might this be?

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: *Telepathic mushroom creatures - myconids - inhabit the Underdark. You must be nearing a myconid colony.*

AD_Myconid_005_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

MushroomField_Warning.speaker: Restless Myconid
MushroomField_Warning.text: ((*after the light comes the bang. step away. step away*))

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: No need for me to ask how you fared - some of my kin have already made it here, safe and sound.
InjuredGnome.context: NodeContext: A little more relaxed than we've seen her - eyeing us up and impressed with what she sees

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: It's past time we were back in the city. But if you find yourself there, call on us. The Ironhand Gnomes are good friends to have.
InjuredGnome.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation +1NodeContext: Impressed and grateful. On the mend

InjuredGnome.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome.text: What will you do when you return?

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: Like I say, we Ironhands make good friends.

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: But bad enemies, too. Some folk are about to be reminded of that.

DirectToSovereign.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the grotesque creature's face and body.*

DirectToSovereign.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign.text: *A voice drifts into your mind as you gaze upon the misshapen servant.*
((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_003: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_000_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The wall is riddled with holes. A suffocating stench of long-rotten meat wafts out.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera on holes in cavern wall

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the holes.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the odour - the foul scent of carrion crawlers, centipede-like aberrations that feast on the dead.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At one time, these caverns must have been their banquet hall. The creatures are either long gone, or waiting patiently in the darkness.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *As you near the rubble, a fragmented voice clutches at your mind.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere starting to Mindmeld with the player

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.context: NodeContext: The original line is 'A True Soul? This is Nere. Tell those Imbiciles to hurry up! I am choking on poison.' Should be recorded normally, and effects should be added later to make it sound like the voice is fading in and out.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: Finally! You must clear... rubble. Filling... poison!

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Stay still. I'll do what I can.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: ...it quick or... head! Careful... mercs... on the edge...

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The view through Nere's eyes is a blur. You only make out a bit of rubble and few moving figures.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: View from Nere's persepective Vision blurred and

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *You sense Nere's frustration, tinged with rage, as the connection fades.*

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpsesInternalNodeContext: Note: speaking of the duergar

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: You don't deserve the death you got. I should have made it last.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpses

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: As for the rest of you slave-worms - you've caused enough trouble.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere rears back to cast a spell at the remaining gnomes

FollowUp.text: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: This was meant to be a simple operation - I arrive, those pack animals clear the debris, and I walk into the temple.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: Instead, I've been beset by incompetence, treachery, and now this. The Absolute's business remains unfinished.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this' he gestures to the broken bridge in front of him.

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: And what business is that, exactly?

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: Important business. My orders come from General Thorm himself.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: I need you to deliver a message to him. Tell the General that I did what I could, but that the route through Grymforge is impassable.

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: The General? Is he a favourite of the Absolute?

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: The favourite. Nothing is done in these lands without his knowledge.

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.Mindmeld: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.
session_synopses.FollowUp: After fighting and killing a group of duergar servants that mutinied against him, Nere takes his rage and frustration out on one of their bodies by kicking it. Once he's done, he takes the players to a nearby broken bridge and explains that he needs reinforcements. The player can promise they'll inform his boss - Chosen Ketheric - or not.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: 'Allo and welcome to Bogrot! Now, kindly - giz all your stuff.
CheckpointGuards.context: NodeContext: A goblin's closest approximation of courtesty, faintly mocking. He's loudly welcoming you to the town he has dubbed 'Bogrot'

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuards.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Well, well, boys. Looks like we got ourselves a trespasser.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips, cockyNodeContext: Half-shouting, smug

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Oi! You just walked into the wrong town.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pointing at playerNodeContext: Half-shouting, smug.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Wait - a drow? In the sun?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Taken aback - this is bad news for them.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Stand down! This one's got a touch of the Absolute about them.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Apologies, your lordship. Hard makin' you out from a distance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Don't let it happen again.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: O-of course. Come and go as you as you like.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: BowsNodeContext: Fearful

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Move it, lads! And show some respect!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shouting around to their comradesNodeContext: Shouting around to their comrades

Warning.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
Warning.text: More of our crowd inside, but we'll send word you're all right.
Warning.context: NodeContext: We've been let past a checkpoint, she's reassuring us we won't be attacked.

CheckpointGuardsWarning.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
CheckpointGuardsWarning.context: NodeContext: We caught him idling at the entrance of a checkpoint. Not trying very hard with the lie.

AD_StartedCombat.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
AD_StartedCombat.text: You must got a death wish, sneakin' around in my town.

session_synopses.CheckpointGuards: This goblin is guarding the entrance to a town his squad have occupied. The residents are long-dead, the town abandoned, and so he's taken it upon himself to rechristen the village as 'Bogrot'.
session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.
session_synopses.Warning: Goblin warrior standing guard in the abandoned village - she's eager for a fight and slightly let down if we talk our way past.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuardsWarning: Backup guard protecting the entrance to a village the goblins have seized

Spotted.speaker: Chock
Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ogres eating a corpse and remark on what it tastes like, custom scene viewer

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Gentlemen - contain yourselves. This quarrel sours our feast. Besides - taste like pork!

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Brothers, look here. I have eyed yet another prize. Fortune favours our bellies!

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lump grins a creepy, hungry grin.|NodeContext: A creepy hungry growl. After he kills the player, he plans to eat them.

session_synopses.Spotted:
Three ogres are eating remains and arguing about what the remains taste like..Then they spy the player, who needs to prove themselves to keep from being eaten.

Two of them are stupid, like most ogres. One of them, Lump, is very smart after accidentally eating a headband of intellect. His voice should be deep, and he should sounds lascivious in the way he speaks of food.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Dry stones line the wall, but the darkness below is impenetrable.*

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

AD_EttercapDisturbanceWarning.context: NodeContext: A bit like a spider chirp, but a bit louder, if possible.

session_synopses.InteractWithWell: Dialogue when first interacting with the well.
session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.AD_EttercapDisturbanceWarning: The ettercap feels that someone stepped on its web and lets out a warning screech.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: Away! Speak to Fezzerk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: Chicken?

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: No. You not chicken.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks. Mistakes you momentarily for a chicken.

AD.speaker: Player
AD.text: This trunk's rotten; shouldn't put too much weight on it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Cautious; just realising how precarious their position is (crossing a dangerously weak tree trunk bridge).

AD_Crack.speaker: c1a1d9d2-d3b5-49fc-ad48-9312552c7caa
AD_Crack.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - wood creaking and snapping under strain.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

session_synopses.AD: The party crosses a fallen tree bridging a gorge. Their senses may perceive that the trunk is rotten and they mustn't cross all at once, or they may remain oblivious to the danger.
session_synopses.AD_Crack: SFX only. A tree trunk bridge across a ravine groans and creaks under the weight of the player as they walk across it. Two seconds after this sound is heard, it'll collapse entirely.

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

session_synopses.VB_OwlBearPrints: The player discovers a large set of animal tracks. They may be able to identify them as those of an owlbear.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: A drow...? Erm, I mean, glory to you, True Soul.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grovelling

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

VB_Bookcase.speaker: Player
VB_Bookcase.text: Hmm. Scratch marks on the floor...
VB_Bookcase.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. Noticed a potential clue in an abandoned house.

VB_Mirror.speaker: Player
VB_Mirror.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. They just detected something strange that they can't put their finger on.

session_synopses.VB_InspectHerbs: The player examines some long-dead herbs in an abandoned house. They may notice the herbs themselves are unusual and exotic - not what you'd typically expect to be cultivated in a small-town apothecary.
session_synopses.VB_Bookcase: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player discovers a clue that leads to the wizard's secret lab.
session_synopses.VB_Mirror: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player notices something odd about a mirror, but they can't quite figure out what (they're in fact detecting the energy of a magical trap that resides within the mirror).
session_synopses.AD_QuasitReactsToTrap: The player has triggered a trap because the quasit gave the wrong answer. Quasit is DELIGHTED. Cackling madly as she runs about.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Send them to the dirt!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Preparing for battle - and excited for it.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: Wha', fun's over? All right then...

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid). Delivery should be vicious and mean-spirited - they're torturing a helpless gnome for sport.
session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin reacts to the decision to leave with slight disappointment.

AD_Goblin_00.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Goblin_00.text: Watch what you touch. If'n it smells like wee it's claimed, right?

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.context: NodeContext: search the place, don't bother me

AD_BossAndSubordinate.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_BossAndSubordinate.text: And you got nothing to show for it but your own arse.

session_synopses.AD_Goblin_00: Goblin is standing in ruined cottage, fiercely protecting what meagre loot they've found.
session_synopses.AD_BossAndSubordinate: Goblins scouting an abandoned village-- boss is tired of his subordinates.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: And deny you the honour of my hospitality?

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Huh. Haven't seen that game in years.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Little sing-song to the tune of 'one, two, buckle my shoe'

session_synopses.PAD: A faded children's game marked on the floor - tic-tac-toe or hopscotch, maybe. Different races remark may or may not recall the game from their youth. Planar or gith might not recognize it - assume it's code.

AD_WaitingForRelease.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_WaitingForRelease.context: NodeContext: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You seem a little confused.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You saved me. Now you'll extort me. That's how this works, yes?
node_data.context: NodeContext: impatient

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I could extort you, if that's what you want.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You're teasing me now. I'm certain of it.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're a little far from home for a deep gnome.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Ignorance is alive and well, it seems! Deep gnomes aren't restricted to the Underdark, you know - I've lived in Baldur's Gate for years.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Testily

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I'm in search of a friend. I fear he's in trouble. He had this locket, see, that I gave him years ago before leaving home.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I found it around the neck of a thug in Baldur's Gate. It was speckled with blood, my friend nowhere to be found.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: But I still have hope. I have reason to believe he's in the Underdark. Hopefully I'll pick up his trail from there.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He talks about the locket but doesn't have it on him to show the player

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I always help my friends.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks player up and down judgementally, player should wonder 'is he talking about me?'InternalNodeContext: He hasn't given player the pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: On that note, I bid thee farewell. If we should meet again... well, we will have met again.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He says his goodbyes, turns and walks away

SlowDown.speaker: Fezzerk
SlowDown.text: What's goin' on back there? Go check it out!
SlowDown.context: NodeContext: He turns to his right as he tells the other goblins to check it out.

AD.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD.text: I'm going to hurl.

session_synopses.AD_WaitingForRelease: Barcus shouts for help - the windmill he's tied to is rotating, and he needs someone to halt it before he can be cut loose. Urgent, at the end of his tether
session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
session_synopses.SlowDown: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely, or speed up, after the player changed the speed. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeFreed: After being let off the pane of the windmill.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: They spoke of the Absolute - same as that goblin, Sazza. Curious.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: Seems as though the Absolute's attracting followers from all kinds of places.

session_synopses.PAD_PostScene: An automated dialog by players, triggered after the scene with the Absolute Cultists in which the True Soul dies is over. The party wonders aloud what the cultists were talking about when they mentioned 'true souls' and 'the Absolute'. They may have a little more context if they already spoke to Sazza, a captured cultist goblin

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

session_synopses.PAD: Players see plans at the workstation where Sampson used to clear his head.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: The bugbear shouts at the players after they barge in on the couple having sex.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

VB_EggPickedUp.speaker: Player
VB_EggPickedUp.text: She'll tear me in two for touching her egg.
VB_EggPickedUp.context: NodeContext: Urgent. The player's taken an owlbear's unhatched egg while in combat with the owlbear mother (think a grizzly bear with a beak).

VB_EnterCave.speaker: Player
VB_EnterCave.text: That stench... dead owlbear prey, no doubt.
VB_EnterCave.context: NodeContext: Upon entering the den of a carnivorous beast. Rotting, half-eaten prey are strewn about. The player previously identified the beast as an owlbear.

VB_CubResolution_1P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_1P.text: Nature can provide for the cub. Perhaps it'll live.
VB_CubResolution_1P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub fend for itself.

session_synopses.VB_EggPickedUp: The player discovers an intact owlbear egg (think something the size of an ostrich egg) and makes an impressed remark. If there's an adult owlbear nearby, the player will remark that interferring with the egg will put them in danger.
session_synopses.VB_EnterCave: The player enters a cave that houses an owlbear - a large, aggressive wild beast. They might comment on the stench of half-eaten prey, or note that some tracks they discovered lead into the cave.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_1P: The players comment briefly on their decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub live or not.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: Stop! I give up! M-mercy, please!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: Desperate, grovelling. He's throwing in the towel as he's on the verge of losing a fight.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.text: I know things. If you let me live, I'll make it worth your while. I p-promise!
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: InternalNodeContext: Non-barbarian flowNodeContext: Scared, bargaining for this life.

Surrender_NotAtWindmill.speaker: Fezzerk
Surrender_NotAtWindmill.context: NodeContext: A final desperate cry (he's killed by the player immediately after this).

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

session_synopses.Surrender_NotAtWindmill: After being defeated in combat, a goblin named Fezzerk begs for mercy from the player. He tries to bargain for his life. The player can let him go or kill him. This dialogue takes place somewhere away from the windmill where Fezzerk was tormenting Barcus Wroot.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

AD_AtCaveEntrance.speaker: Andrick
AD_AtCaveEntrance.text: Bloody Ed. I wish he'd listened.

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.text: We survived - I can't believe we survived!

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.context: NodeContext: Suddenly remembering he's talking to a superior.

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Novice Andrick bows before they depart

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist001_InCave.text: What were you doing before the owlbear attacked?

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.text: We were sent to look for fugitives. Some survivors from a crashed ship a ways west along the Chionthar.

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.text: The Absolute wants them found, one way or another.

session_synopses.AD_AtCaveEntrance: Two junior members of a cult have been sent to hunt the wild creature that killed their superior. They've found its nest, but are reluctant to proceed inside and face the beast.
session_synopses.Cultist001_InCave: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, has been sent by his supposed superior to attack an owlbear - a wild creature that killed another cultist. He needs to be be emboldened to attack the beast with a small pep talk. If the player does something to arouse suspicion however, Andrick may realise he's been tricked and turn hostile.

AD_FoundJournal.speaker: Player
AD_FoundJournal.text: Someone's diary. Might explain what happened here.

session_synopses.AD_FoundJournal: The party finds a old diary in the ruined schoolhouse of an abandoned village. They comment that it might shed some light on what happened here.
session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteRitualScroll: Reflection on the Selunite Ritual scroll found in the Owlbear cave

session_synopses.001: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won him over previously in the forest, he'll refer to this and speak deferentially.

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.text: Gonna poke some extra holes in you!

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_002.text: The Absolute's got my back - I ain't afraid of nothin'!

session_synopses.EmptyMindflayerPod: Players encountered an empty pod in forest.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Mm, mm, mm. Fortune favours my belly, for there is no meat more succulent than a stranger's.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Dinnertime!

session_synopses: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

AD_ForgeWeapon.speaker: Player
AD_ForgeWeapon.text: There's still life left in this old thing.

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.VB_TakeSussurSap: Voice bark: player takes sussur sap from a tree. SUSS-er. Needed to make a special weapon.
session_synopses.VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear: Player sees a phase spider slip in and out of reality.Probably not clear exactly what it was.
session_synopses.VB_FindWeakWall: Player finds a weak wall. Something's behind it.
session_synopses.AD_ForgeWeapon: The player clicks on a forge. What they say depends on how much of the recipe they have collected. They can make a fancy weapon with the right ingredients.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.text: Chest's unlocked. My prayers are answered.
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a prayer unlocking a magically sealed chest.

session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer: The player passes comment after they manage to open a magically sealed chest by reciting a prayer they found. If Shadowheart or a worshipper of Shar is speaking, the prayer does nothing.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
node_data.text: What do ya want? I'm not the one in charge.

session_synopses: A goblin raider, part of a patrol roaming the forest. Currently tormenting a deep gnome prisoner by tying him to a windmill. If the player gets too close, the goblin turns hostile - unless the player is a drow, in which case the goblin is servile.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Fresh air, at last.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Your boldness is a blessing - I'm in your debt.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Listen close: drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears may be believed.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I must report to the Flaming Fist manip, with haste.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: And you - I must ask again for your aid.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: May I trust you'll see it through?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll rescue Duke Ravengard. You have my word.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll search for Duke Ravengard.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Thank you. And should your courage falter, remember the Duke's generosity.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Approach the Towers with care - the land itself has been swallowed in shadow.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Go. You should pick up the drow trail with ease.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I will seek reinforcements and join you when I can.

session_synopses.AD_Trapped: Desire calls out to anyone that can listen, as she is trapped in a room in a burning building.
session_synopses: Councilor Florrick is working in secret for a dragon in the city of Baldur's Gate. She is acting as an advisor to Grand Duke Ravengard. She should come across as good but no nonsense. SHe is used to getting her way.
session_synopses.AD_FF2: If Yeva is unavailable, Ito calls out that it's the Duke's counsellor trapped in the burning building.
session_synopses.AD_FloorCollapse: A piece of the floor of the room in which Desire is trapped just collapsed.

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: pocketing the moneyNodeContext: said while pocketing the money looted from his dead friend

Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved after a fight, checking up on his companion

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: I'm fine. And so's the chest, more importantly.
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved, responding to a companion about his wellbeing

Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.text: Ah, Rugan... old bastard thought he'd live forever.
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: NodeContext: wry comment on the death of a companion... sad, but pragmatic

Agent_001_Cave.text: There's nothing in there that'll help - leave it!
Agent_001_Cave.context: InternalNodeContext: Quiet conversation(?) - the afraid of the gnolls and don't want to provoke them

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: If we don't deal with them gnolls, none of us are getting out of here alive.
Agent_001_Cave.context: CinematicNodeContext: Showing the gnolls at the entrance of the cave.NodeContext: Urgency, panic

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Player
Agent_001_Cave.text: One of us is getting out of here richer - I don't fight for free.
Agent_001_Cave.context: InternalNodeContext: Could make a non-persuasion node (auto-success)

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Fine. Money's useless to dead men.
Agent_001_Cave.context: NodeContext: Offering to pay for our help. Abrupt - wants to get this out of the way

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Damn it... must have dropped my purse.
Agent_001_Cave.context: NodeContext: patting down his pockets, confused

Agent_001_Cave.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_Cave.text: Get us out of this, and I swear we'll make it worth your while.

Agents_AD_Joining.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Joining.text: Take the leader down - I'll try to hold the rest back!
Agents_AD_Joining.context: NodeContext: Shouting orders as a fight against a gnoll pack starts

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: panicked, shouting to a companion across a small cave as they attempt to hold off an attack

Agents_AD_FlasksLow.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.text: Keep steady. We're not finished yet.
Agents_AD_FlasksLow.context: NodeContext: raised voice, trying to impose calm on a panicked situation

AD_BetweenAgents.text: There must be another way out!

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: There is. Hurl yourself into the chasm back there.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Aye. It'd be quicker than having your guts torn out by them beasts.

Agent_002_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_002_Dead.context: NodeContext: after successfully casting a speak with dead spell

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.
session_synopses.Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for Olly after he fought gnolls and is the only agent who survived.
session_synopses.Agent_001_Cave: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Joining: One-shot AD for Rugan when Zhents join the fight with the gnolls.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_FlasksLow: Trapped in a cave by monsters, Olly and Rugan are running low on fire flasks.Olly is panicking and shouting to Rugan as they attempt to hold the line; Rugan is more experienced and putting on a calmer, braver face.
session_synopses.AD_BetweenAgents: Non critpath: conversation between two zhent agents while they are trappedwaiting in a cave. In the first three branches, they are desperate and out of breath as they throw flasks of fire at the cave entrance to hold off a pack of gnolls. In the final flow, the gnolls are gone. The characters are more relaxed, but traumatised by the experience.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Oll, a young Zhentarim agent

node_data.speaker: Benryn
node_data.text: The fire - hurry! Get this thing off of me!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stuck under wooden beamNodeContext: Panicking, wheezing/coughing

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Brace yourself to lift the wreckage.
True

node_data.speaker: Benryn
node_data.text: Almost... there!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts the beam a couple of inches. He rolls out from under the beam on "There". Player drops it after he's free.

PAD_FoundChest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundChest.text: Looks like there's a chest buried in that hay.

PAD_Door.speaker: Player
PAD_Door.text: The heat coming off that door... opening it could spell trouble.

PAD_TooHeavy.speaker: Player
PAD_TooHeavy.context: CinematicNodeContext: You click on the beam and you lift it or you don't (there is no animation or cut scene) so maybe mocap of the player's face looking frustrated...?NodeContext: You've just tried to life something and it's too heavy for you.

AD_FoundWife.speaker: Benryn
AD_FoundWife.context: NodeContext: Benryn has found his wife's body. He's absolutely devastated - he was afraid she had been killed, but he was holding out hope.

AD_ToWife.speaker: Benryn
AD_ToWife.text: She's not here. Maybe she's all right.
AD_ToWife.context: NodeContext: Hopeful, but not entierly convinced.

session_synopses:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.The barbarian class will have advantage in a strength check to lift the wreckage off Benryn, however if they fail, they can try again with a higher DC. Failure the second time will lead to more debris collapsing and killing Benryn.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundChest: An AD that plays when you notice the dowry in the stack of hay.
session_synopses.PAD_Door: This VB plays when players near a door that will explode upon opening. It serves as a warning to players that opening the door will require quick action, suggesting the use of turn-based mode.
session_synopses.AD_Rescued: This AD plays after the player has safely exited the burning inn with Benryn in tow. He is shocked by the scene he sees in the courtyard - blood and corpses everywhere.
session_synopses.AD_Escaping: This AD plays after Benryn has been rescued and has subsequently joined the party. They are within a  burning building. Once players safely exit the building, Benryn leaves the party and further dialogues become available.In this dialogue, Benryn is
session_synopses.PAD_TooHeavy: Player's trying to lift the beams off the half-elf, has previously failed the skill check, and cannot enter interactive dialogue. There is no cutscene or animation - you lift it or you don't - the half-elf is just suddenly free. In this PAD they failed the check and can't lift it.
session_synopses.AD_FoundWife: Benryn has been freed from a burning inn after becoming trapped during a drow/goblin attack. He's just found his wife's body. He'd been holding out hope that she was still alive.
session_synopses.AD_ToWife: This AD plays after the player has told Benryn where he can find his wife's body. He doesn't want to believe it, but he knows it is probably true. If the corpse has been moved after players tell him where he can find her, he has a spark of hope - she's not there, so perhaps she is still alive after all.

PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.speaker: Player
PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.text: Are we really going to hunt a devil on their behalf?

PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.speaker: Player
PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.text: The truth is, if there is a devil running wild, we might have to deal with it one way or another.

session_synopses.PAD_RefugeesAreCultists: Reflection dialog that plays after discovering that the paladins hunting Karlach made a deal with the arch-devil Zariel. The party reflects on whether these people deserve to be punished for dealing with a devil, or whether we should help them.Speaker 1 has agreed to help them. Speaker 2 comments on th is decision. Karlach cannot take part in this dialog.

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Sarth Baretha, a mid-ranking githyanki warriorv who was ordered to search Faerûn for a mysterious stolen weapon.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across a pair of old skeletons with harper and druid equipment. A successful history skill check will reveal these two were probably part of the Harper/druid alliance that fought against Ketheric's army of Shar. If the player has seen the frescos in the Druid's Circle of the Den depicting the battle between the Sharran troops and the Harpers/Druids, they will automatically jump to the 'Success' node.

session_synopses: This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble).A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on her way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

session_synopses.AD_PerceptionSucceeded: Player line that triggers on encountering the Zhentarim hideout - in case of successful perception roll, failed perception roll, or having been told of the hideout in advance
session_synopses: Salazon is preparing a fire-trap at the entrance to his gang's hideout. We can either sneak up on him or be sneaked up on in turn - either way we have to convince him we should be there or he'll get skittish and blow us all up. In general he's jumpy and suspicious of us, but relieved when we convince him we're a friend. Think an inexperienced guard pointing a gun at us when he's been told to be on alert.

Hyena_002.text: Hey. Hi. You're here. What're you, then?

Hyena_002.speaker: Player
Hyena_002.text: I'm a god, walking in mortal flesh.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *She is still ravenous, her mind a hungry pit. The flesh of her pack wasn't enough to satisfy her.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: 'she' is a monstrous gnoll - it is hungry for the player's flesh. Anxiety in the player's voice

Flind.speaker: Player
Flind.text: Dominate her mind, commanding her to feast on herself.

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *Her tadpole responds, thrashing violently, and the fragile tissue of her brain tears and splits.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: triumphant but disgusted - witnessing a horrifying injury that we caused to an enemy through psychic connection

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *You taste the blood in her throat, feel it pooling in the cavity of her skull. But she still resists.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: growing anxiety - feeling resistance of a wounded enemy through a psychic connection

Flind.speaker: Player
Flind.text: Harness your willpower, and order her to devour herself.

Flind.speaker: Narrator

Flind.context: NodeContext: watching a beast - the flind - preparing to devour itself. We commanded her to do this, but it's still horrifying

session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01: A Fang of Yeenoghu (magically gifted gnoll) communicates with a barking hyena-like laugh
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_01: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
